questions.question: Who does not qualify for a driving license?
questions.choice0: An applicant who his age is 17 years old.
questions.choice1: An applicant who his age is 18 years old.
questions.choice2: An applicant who his age is 21 years old.
questions.explaination: Answer A. In order to qualify for a driving license to drive or ride in Singapore, an applicant must be at least 18 years old. There are still other requirement apart from this

questions.question: Who does not qualify for a driving license?
questions.choice0: An applicant who is not suffering from mental disorder.
questions.choice1: An applicant who is not suffering from epilepsy.
questions.choice2: An applicant who is not able to distinguish the colours red, amber and green from a distance of 25 meters.
questions.explaination: Answer A. In order to qualify for a driving license to driver or ride in Singapore, an applicant must not be suffering from mental disorder, epilepsy and able to distinguish the colours red, amber and green from a distance of 25 metres.

questions.question: Which of the following are required to pass so that an applicant can drive?
questions.choice0: Basic Theory Test (BTT), Final Theory Test (FTT), Practical Driving.
questions.choice1: Basic Theory Test (BTT) and Final Theory Test (FTT)
questions.choice2: Basic Theory Test (BTT), Final Theory Test (FTT), Practical Riding Test.
questions.explaination: Answer A. In order to drive in Singapore, an applicant must pass Basic Theory Test (BTT), Final Theory Test (FTT) and Practical Driving.

questions.question: After you have passed your FTT, you are required to pass the Practical Driving Test within _________ years.
questions.explaination: Answer B. After you have passed your FTT, you are required to pass the Practical Driving Test within two years, failing which, you will have to retake and pass your FTT again before you can apply for another Practical Driving Test.

questions.question: Which of the following are required to pass so that an applicant can ride?
questions.choice0: Basic Theory Test (BTT), Riding Theory Test (RTT), Final Theory Test (FTT), Practical Riding.
questions.choice1: Basic Theory Test (BTT), Final Theory Test (FTT), Practical Driving.
questions.choice2: Basic Theory Test (BTT), Riding Theory Test (RTT), Practical Riding.
questions.explaination: Answer C.

questions.question: When are you able to apply for a Provisional Driving License (PDL)?
questions.explaination: Answer B. After passing your BTT, you can apply for PDL.

questions.question: Which is a Provisional Driving License (PDL) for?
questions.choice0: PDL allows you to start learning to drive or ride on the roads with a driving instructor.
questions.choice1: PDL allows you to drive or ride on the roads with any driver who has a license.
questions.choice2: PDL allows you to drive on the roads by yourselves.
questions.explaination: Answer A. Provisional Driving License (PDL) to start learning to drive or ride on the roads with your driving instructor.

questions.question: What is the validity period for a Provisional Driving License (PDL)?
questions.explaination: Answer A. A PDL is valid for 2 years from the date of grant and can be renewed subsequently for every 2 years.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct as a Provisional Driving License (PDL) holder?
questions.choice0: You must display one 18 cm square L plates on the front of your motor vehicle during your driving lessons and driving tests.
questions.choice1: You must display one 18 cm square L plates on the back of your motor vehicle during your driving lessons and driving tests.
questions.choice2: You must display two 18 cm square L plates on both front and back of your motor vehicle during your driving lessons and driving tests.
questions.explaination: Answer C.

questions.question: A new driver who holds a new class of driving licenses shall be under probation for how many years?
questions.explaination: Answer A. New drivers shall be under probation for one year from the date of grant of the new driving license to them.

questions.question: The image below means?
questions.explaination: Answer B. Probation Plate.

questions.question: Where should the probation plate be displayed at for Class 2B motor vehicle?
questions.choice0: Above the headlamp and above the rear license plate.
questions.choice1: Above or below the headlamp and above or below the rear license plate.
questions.choice2: Below the headlamp and below the rear license plate.
questions.explaination: Answer B. A class 2B motor vehicle should display the probation plate directly above or below the headlamp and directly above or below the rear license plate.

questions.question: What will happen if a new driver fails to place the probation plate?
questions.choice0: Fined. For repeat offenders with at least 2 offenses of failing to display, the license will be revoked.
questions.choice2: Answer A. Revoke license for one year.

questions.question: What will happen if a new driver accumulates 13 or more demerit points during probation period?
questions.explaination: Answer A. A new driver who accumulates 13 or more demerit points during the one year probation period will also have his/her new driving license revoked.

questions.question: What is a Class 3 driving license?
questions.choice0: Motor cars constructed solely and adapted to carry not more than 7 passengers (exclusive of the driver).
questions.choice1: Motor cars without clutch pedals (auto) of an unladen weight not exceeding 3000 kg with not more than 7 passengers, exclusive of the driver.
questions.choice2: Motorcars of an unladen weight not exceeding 3000 kg with not more than 7 passengers, exclusive of the driver.
questions.explaination: Answer C. Motorcars of an unladen weight not exceeding 3000 kg with not more than 7 passengers, exclusive of the driver

questions.question: When are you allowed to overtake on the left?

questions.question: Which is the following is the correct step when overtaking?
questions.choice0: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Check bind Spot. 4) Signal right. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.
questions.choice1: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Check mirror. 8) Signal left. 9) move left. 10) Cancel signal. 11) Resume normal speed.
questions.choice2: 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.
questions.explaination: Answer C. The 12 steps are 1) Check traffic ahead. 2) Check traffic behind. 3) Signal right. 4) Check bind Spot. 5) Move right. 6) Accelerate. 7) Tap horn (if neccessary). 8) Check mirror. 9) Signal left. 10) move left. 11) Cancel signal. 12) Resume normal speed.

questions.question: What is road hogging?
questions.choice0: Road-Hogging is driving on the right-hand of the road.
questions.choice1: Road-Hogging is driving at an unreasonably fast speed on the road especially on the right-hand of the road.
questions.choice2: Road-Hogging is driving at an unreasonably slow speed on the road especially on the right-hand or along the centre of the road.
questions.explaination: Answer C. Road-Hogging is driving at an unreasonably slow speed on the road especially on the right-hand or along the centre of the road.

questions.question: If the speed limit of the road is not stated, what is the speed limit of the road?
questions.explaination: Answer C. Unless otherwise stated, the speed limit of all roads in Singapore is 50 km/h. Do not exceed the speed limit of your vehicle or the road, whichever is the lesser.

questions.question: When appraching a junction with a major road, you should
questions.choice0: Slow down gradually and give way to traffic on the major road.
questions.choice1: Look the the right and if there is no vehicle, speed up and join the major road.
questions.choice2: Slow down and sound a horn to inform any incoming vehicle on the major road.
questions.explaination: Answer A. Slow down gradually and give way to traffic on the major road. Where there is a STOP sign, stop before the stop-line.

questions.question: At an uncontrolled junction, which car have the right of way?
questions.explaination: Answer A. Car B because driver must give way to traffic going straight from the right.

questions.question: What should you do when you are turning right (Car A) at an uncontrolled junction?
questions.choice0: Give way to car C and B only.
questions.choice1: Continue turning as cars C, D and B should give away to you
questions.choice2: Give way to cars C, D and B
questions.explaination: Answer C. If you are turning right, you must give way to traffic going straight from all directions

questions.question: What should you do when you are turning right (Car A) at an uncontrolled junction?
questions.choice0: Give way to car B only
questions.choice1: Give way to cars C and B
questions.choice2: Give way to car C only.
questions.explaination: Answer B. If you are turning right, you must give way to traffic turning right from the right and traffic turning left from the opposite direction.

questions.question: If you are turning left, should you give way to traffic going straight from the right?
questions.explaination: Answer C. If you are turning left, you must give way to traffic going straight from the right.

questions.question: At the junction, when the traffic signal is green, you should
questions.choice0: Reply on signals to go ahead given by unauthorised persons
questions.choice1: Proceed as thr signal is green
questions.choice2: Look right, the left and right again before proceeding
questions.explaination: Answer C. At a junction, look right, then left, then right again. Do not proceed until you are sure that it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When turning right into a two-way street, you should
questions.choice0: swing out to the left before or after making the turn.
questions.choice1: turn into the extreme right lane of the road you are turning into.
questions.choice2: turn into the lane just left of the centre line of the road you are turning into.
questions.explaination: Answer C. turn into the lane just left of the centre line of the road you are turning into.

questions.question: When turning right into a one-way street, you should
questions.choice0: turn into the extreme right lane of the road you are turning into.
questions.choice1: turn into the extreme left lane of the road you are turning into.
questions.choice2: turn into the lane just left of the centre line of the road you are turning into.
questions.explaination: Answer A. turn into the extreme right lane of the road you are turning into.

questions.question: When turning left, you should
questions.choice0: Signal in a good time and do not swing out to the right before or after making the turn
questions.choice1: Signal in a good time and swing out to the right before or after making the turn

questions.explaination: Answer A.

questions.question: When you are appraching a roundabout, you should

questions.question: Which lane(s) is/are car allowed to go?

questions.question: Which persons(s) should be belted up when travelling in vehicle?
questions.choice1: All persons irrespective of their age
questions.explaination: Answer B. All persons travelling in vehicles, irrespective of their age, should be appropriately belted up.

questions.question: Should an adult or children height below 1.35m wear seat belt?
questions.choice0: No, these person are exempted from wearing it.
questions.choice1: Yes, normal seat belt will be enough.
questions.choice2: Yes, use booster seats or approved adjustable seat belts to lower the risk of injury in the event of an accident.
questions.explaination: Answer C. Adults below the height of 1.35m shall use booster seats or approved adjustable seat belts to lower the risk of injury in the event of an accident.

questions.question: When driving at night, what time should the headlights be on?
questions.explaination: Answer C. At night (between 7.00pm and 7.00am) you must drive with your headlights on.

questions.question: At night in built-up areas and during rainy weather, what type of headlight should you turn on?
questions.explaination: Answer B. Dipped headlights at night in built-up areas and during rainy weather.

questions.question: Should you use high beam on unlit roads?
questions.choice0: Yes but dip your headlights when meeting other vehicles and cyclists.
questions.choice1: No as it may dazzled by the lights of another vehicle
questions.choice2: No as it is dangerous to use high beam
questions.explaination: Answer A. On unlit roads always use your high beam. Dip your headlights when meeting other vehicles and cyclists.

questions.question: When driving behind other vehicles in an unlit road, you should
questions.explaination: Answer C. Dip your headlights when driving behind other vehicles.

questions.question: In the daytime, whenever visibility is poor or if it is raining you should
questions.explaination: Answer B. In the daytime whenever visibility is poor or if it is raining, switch on your headlights. This is to enable other road users to see your vehicle.

questions.question: Switching on headlights during the day or night
questions.choice0: will use up all your battery
questions.choice1: will use more of your fuel consumption
questions.choice2: will not in any way affect your fuel consumption
questions.explaination: Answer C. Switching on your headlights will not in any way affect your fuel consumption.

questions.question: Parking in an area that is unlit or poorly lit, you should
questions.choice1: Park your vehicle with lights on
questions.choice2: Park your vehicle with high beam on.
questions.explaination: Answer B. It is advisable when parking in unlit or poorly lit roads at night to leave your side or parking lights on.

questions.question: Where should you look when an oncoming vehicle is driving toward you?
questions.choice0: Look directly at the headlights of oncoming vehicles
questions.choice1: Direct your vision slightly to the left
questions.choice2: Look at the top of the oncoming vehicles
questions.explaination: Answer B. Direct your vision slightly to the left can save you from momentary blindness.

questions.question: When approaching a curve or intersection with poor visibility, you should
questions.choice1: On headlight even during the day
questions.explaination: Answer A. It is a good idea to flash your headlights to let pedestrians and oncoming cyclists and motorists know that you are heading into the curve or intersection.

questions.question: When should you on interior lights?
questions.choice1: Anytime when it is safe to do so
questions.explaination: Answer A. Only on interior lights when you are not driving

questions.question: With small quantity consumed, should you drive?
questions.explaination: Answer A. when even a small quantity has been consumed, makes you less safe on the roads

questions.question: The prescribed legal limit for blood alcohol content is
questions.choice0: 80 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of blood
questions.choice1: 100 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of blood
questions.choice2: 100 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 80 millilitres (ml) of blood
questions.explaination: Answer A. 80 milligrammes (mg) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of blood

questions.question: The prescribed legal limit for breath is
questions.choice0: 35 microgrammes (ug) of alcohol per 80 millilitres (ml) of breath
questions.choice1: 50 microgrammes (ug) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of breath
questions.choice2: 35 microgrammes (ug) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of breath
questions.explaination: Answer C. 35 microgrammes (ug) of alcohol per 100 millilitres (ml) of breath

questions.question: Can also be charged for drink driving even when the blood or breath alcohol content is below the legal limit?
questions.choice1: No because it is not allowed as what the law stated.
questions.choice2: Yes if there is evidence to show that he/she was unable to control the vehicle because of alcoholic intoxication.
questions.explaination: Answer C. Yes if there is evidence to show that he/she was unable to control the vehicle because of alcoholic intoxication.

questions.question: The penalty for drink driving is
questions.choice0: Fine of between $1,000 and $5,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months.
questions.choice1: Fine of between $0 and $5,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months.
questions.choice2: Fine of between $200 and $1,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months.
questions.explaination: Answer A. Fine of between $1,000 and $5,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months.

questions.question: What should do before moving off?
questions.choice0: On interior light, fasten seat belt, look in the mirros, give proper signal, check on traffic and pedestrains then move off
questions.choice1: Fasten seat belt, look in the mirros, give proper signal, check on traffic and pedestrains then move off
questions.choice2: Fasten seat belt, give proper signal, check on traffic and pedestrains then move off
questions.explaination: Answer B. Before you move off, fasten your seat belt and look in the mirrors. Give the proper signal, look around to check on traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: When should you check or look at the mirrors?
questions.choice0: before moving off, changing lane, overtaking and making any turn
questions.choice1: before moving off, slowing down, stopping, changing lane, overtaking and making any turn
questions.choice2: before moving off, stopping, changing lane, overtaking and making any turn
questions.explaination: Answer B. before moving off, slowing down, stopping, changing lane, overtaking and making any turn

questions.question: You should check your mirrors every ______ while driving along
questions.explaination: Answer C. 5 to 10 seconds

questions.question: What is blind spots?

questions.choice1: The areas on the right and left of your vehicle which cannot be viewed by you
questions.choice2: The areas on the right and left of your vehicle which cannot be viewed by your other drivers
questions.explaination: Answer A. The areas on the right and left of your vehicle which cannot be viewed in your mirrors

questions.question: How do you check for traffic in the blind spots?
questions.choice0: Look over your shoulder to the left or the right to check for traffic in the blind spots
questions.choice1: Look at the right and left of mirror of your vehicle to check for traffic in the blind spots
questions.choice2: Look down and up to check for traffic in the blind spots
questions.explaination: Answer A. Look over your shoulder to the left or the right to check for traffic in the blind spots

questions.question: When should you check your blind spots?
questions.explaination: Answer C. All of the above

questions.question: Always give clear signals well in advance of your intentions at least ___ seconds before your manoeuvre
questions.explaination: Answer C. 3

questions.question: What is tailgating?

questions.choice2: Following too closely behind another vehicle
questions.explaination: Answer C. Following too closely behind another vehicle

questions.question: Why tailgating is dangerous?
questions.choice0: If the vehicle in front stops suddenly, an accident is inevitable since you will not be able to stop in time.
questions.choice1: You might blind the driver in front which make him/her hard to see
questions.choice2: Vehicle is hard to stop when it is rainning
questions.explaination: Answer A. If the vehicle in front stops suddenly, an accident is inevitable since you will not be able to stop in time.

questions.question: The space between your vehicle and the vehicle in front, should be at least how many car length for every 16km/h of your speed?

questions.question: What is two-second rule?

questions.explaination: Answer A. Safe gap between you and the vehicle in front

questions.question: How should you count the two-second rule?
questions.choice2: one thousand and one, one thousand and two
